title: Jeffrey Barry release ‘blunders’ led to neighbour murder – BBC News
textBody: <![CDATA[ & amp;#8216;A man with schizophrenia who repeatedly stabbed a train passenger after yelling  & amp;#8220;I want to kill all the Muslims & amp;#8221; has been found not guilty of attempted murder by reason of insanity. Full StoryBBC News, 22nd August 2017Source: www.bbc.co.uk]]>

title: Schizophrenic ‘Muslim killer’ not guilty by reason of insanity – BBC News
textBody: <![CDATA[ & amp;#8216;Rapists, armed robbers, arsonists… At Bethlem Royal Hospital, medical teams try to rehabilitate some of Britain’s most violent, mentally ill patients. title: Inside the psych ward: Can Britain’s most dangerous criminals really be rehabilitated? – Daily Telegraph
textBody: <![CDATA[ & amp;#8216;A former Broadmoor hospital worker has been jailed for eight months for selling stories to the Sun about notorious patients, including the Yorkshire Ripper. & amp;#8217; Full story The Guardian, 26th November 2015 Source: www.guardian.co.uk]]>

title: Ex-Broadmoor worker jailed for selling stories to the Sun – The Guardian
textBody: <![CDATA[ & amp;#8216;Broadmoor Hospital has been told to make urgent changes after a report which highlighted the  & amp;#8220;overuse & amp;#8221; of face-down restraints on patients. title: Broadmoor Hospital inspection reveals ‘urgent’ changes required – BBC News
